title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Brandon Rose. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Using API Tokens
text: time writting article 53 API methods redcap. 52 accessible regular user token. 1 requires super token. 27 methods exports; 14 imports; 8 deletes; 4 .

title: Using API Tokens
text: RosyREDCap intentionally avoids modifying metadata user DAGs using API, choosing instead focus primarily exporting relevant data advanced users, giving access uploads, files, file repository. current RosyREDCap API coverage 26 52 available methods (50%). Crucially, standardized behind wrappers. user can leverage methods handful key functions. short package loads last save (setup_DB load_DB), checks log updates, gets changes local object (update_DB). multiple projects can toggle projects can create custom outputs derived feed (run_RosyREDCap).

title: Get Started
text: get REDCap turned R database… can set REDCap token three ways! need help setting tokens see article –> placeholder
code: library("RosyREDCap")  projects <- get_projects() # get list of cached projects  View(projects) # show your previously saved projects  DB <- setup_DB(   short_name = "TEST_repeating",   redcap_base = "https://redcap.miami.edu/", # change to your institutions link   dir_path = getwd(), # or change to your intended file path   # force = T, # use this to force a refresh   merge_form_name = "patient",   use_csv = FALSE, # if you don't have Microsoft change to TRUE   auto_check_token = TRUE ) #1. set each time in your session (not recommended in saved/shared scripts!) Sys.setenv(RosyREDCap_token_TEST = "YoUrNevErShaReToken")  #2. set to your private R sessions! usethis::edit_r_environ() #finds your file # Then you add --> RosyREDCap_token_TEST = 'YoUrNevErShaReToken' # then save file and restart R  # If it worked you will see your token when you run... Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") #And if your DB object is setup properly... #3. Using the REDCap console DB<-load_DB("TEST") set_REDCap_token(DB) # can see if it's set correctly view_REDCap_token(DB)

title: Get Started
text: following functions represent core functions package.
code: DB <- update_DB(DB) # update from redcap by checking log and using saved object   DB <- add_forms_transformation_to_DB(DB,forms_tranformation = default_forms_transformation(DB))  DB <- transform_DB(DB) # transform to most basic forms, can be modified  DB <- drop_redcap_dir(DB)  #run shiny app! run_RosyREDCap()  # dev functions not ready for public yet DB <- clean_DB(DB) DB <- summarize_DB(DB) #can use for subsets! DB <- summarize_DB(DB) DB %>% save_summary() # will save summary data, look at the tabs!

title: Get Started
code: DB$metadata %>% add_list_to_global()  DB$data %>% add_list_to_global()  #DB$summary %>% add_list_to_global() #not ready for public  listviewer::jsonedit(DB) # view object

title: Tokens
text: REDCap API tokens equivalent username password. never shared anyone. Ideally, never directly written R script, especially plan sharing future. Never commit file containing token git GitHub forever history. ever doubt mind quickly regenerate token REDCap website. working real REDCap project ’s good practice regenerate token periodically, week, just safe. Precisely tokens sensitive, RosyREDCap designed reference name token, “RosyREDCap_token_TEST”. RosyREDCap ever wants use token make API call REDCap, check Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST"). default token names start “RosyREDCap_token_”, followed short_name chose setup_DB().demonstrates set check tokens…

what: Setting Your Token for One Session
title: Tokens
text: can also set manually base R. Unless specifically set token Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") blank. Now token set R session . restarted R, blank .
code: library("RosyREDCap") Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") #>[1] "" # Assuming you already setup or loaded a DB object you can set the token like this... DB <- load_DB("TEST") set_REDCap_token(DB) # Set your token manually Sys.setenv(RosyREDCap_token_TEST="a_FaKe_TOkEn") # again having this in a script is not advised but possible  # Get your token Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") #>[1] "a_FaKe_TOkEn"

what: Setting Your Token for Any Session
title: Tokens
text: may find want reuse token, may several projects, convenient way store tokens separate location. One way personal .Renviron file. , check always confirm location file make sure ’s part cloud storage git GitHub. can use usethis::edit_r_environ() semi-permanently save token. time launch R session file run token visible specifically called Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST"). Open .Renviron file usethis::edit_r_environ() Add token like … RosyREDCap_token_TEST = "faKeTokeN" Save file Close Restart R Session (Session tab .rs.restartR()). Confirm Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") reference token ever made saved RosyREDCap name. example, RosyREDCap DB object token name DB$token_name. future, may set token different way.
code: #Install usethis if you don't have it. #install.packages("usethis")  usethis::edit_r_environ() # Now save your token.... (without the comment symbol '#') # RosyREDCap_token_TEST = "faKeTokeN" # Save the file and Close # Restart R Session (session tab) # .rs.restartR() # this will also restart R session for you. Sys.getenv("RosyREDCap_token_TEST") # now should contain your token

title: RosyREDCap
text: R (ideally RStudio) installed computer. Access least one REDCap project (real test) API Token Privileges according User Rights. Permission export analyze date project.

title: RosyREDCap
text: R REDCap widely utilized medicine, including basic science, clinical research, clinal trials. independent strengths, together can create powerful data pipelines. several R packages exist extracting data using REDCap API, RosyREDCap stands offering comprehensive extraction metadata data REDCap project standardized R list object, facilitating effortless downstream use exports, imports, transformation, applications. showcased exploratory data analysis shiny app included package. three core aims RosyREDCap … Maintain local version database (DB) object calling recently updated records using REDCap log. Allow imports non-coded versions dataset using R Excel/CSV. Launch shiny app allows explore REDCap projects. leveraging combined strengths R REDCap, users can maintain strong clinical data pipelines, collected processed appropriately improve research patient care. RosyREDCap can used base data object data quality tool REDCap projects aid collection, monitoring, transformation, analysis.

title: RosyREDCap
code: library("RosyREDCap")  projects <- get_projects() # get list of cached projects print.data.frame(projects) # show your previously saved projects  your_project_path <- getwd() print(your_project_path) # confirm this is where you want files saved  DB <- setup_DB(   short_name = "TEST_repeating",   redcap_base = "https://redcap.yourinstitution.edu/", # change to your institutions link (stop at ".edu/")   dir_path = getwd() # or change to your intended file path ) #defaults will autocheck for valid token or ask you.  #if you had to set a token above you might need to select the code below again for it to run DB <- update_DB(DB) # update from redcap by checking log and using saved object   DB <- DB %>% deidentify_DB(drop_free_text = F) %>% drop_REDCap_to_directory() # will save DEIDENTIFIED data (assuming this is set up properly on REDCap) #use drop_free_text = T to be even safer  # DB <- drop_REDCap_to_directory(DB) # will save IDENTIFIED data (assuming this is set up properly on REDCap)  #run shiny app! run_RosyREDCap() # will work with multiple REDCap projects!

title: Generate REDCap Project Diagram — REDCap_diagram
text: Generates diagram REDCap project structure based `DB` object.

title: Generate REDCap Project Diagram — REDCap_diagram
code: REDCap_diagram(   DB,   static = F,   render = T,   duplicate_forms = T,   clean_names = T,   include_fields = F,   include_choices = F,   hierarchical = F,   direction = "LR" )

title: Generate REDCap Project Diagram — REDCap_diagram
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_DB setup_DB static Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, generates static diagram `DiagrammeR`. FALSE, generates interactive diagram `visnetwork`. Default `FALSE`. render Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, renders diagram. Default `TRUE`. duplicate_forms Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes duplicate form nodes diagram. Default `TRUE`. clean_names Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, cleans names forms fields diagram. Default `TRUE`. include_fields Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes fields diagram. Default `FALSE`. include_choices Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes choices diagram. Default `FALSE`. hierarchical Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, generates hierarchical diagram. Default `FALSE`. direction Character string specifying direction diagram. Options "LR" (left right), "TB" (top bottom), "RL" (right left), "BT" (bottom top). Default "LR".

title: Generate REDCap Project Diagram — REDCap_diagram
text: diagram object representing REDCap project structure.

title: Generate REDCap Project Diagram — REDCap_diagram
text: function generates visual diagram REDCap project structure, including forms, fields, choices. supports various options rendering diagram, including fields choices, specifying direction diagram.

what: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_DB_subset
title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_DB_subset
text: Creates subset main REDCap database (`DB`) based specific filter criteria saves specified directory. subset can customized additional forms, fields, deidentification options.

title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_DB_subset
code: add_DB_subset(   DB,   subset_name,   filter_field,   filter_choices,   dir_other = file.path(DB$dir_path, "output"),   file_name = paste0(DB$short_name, "_", subset_name),   form_names = NULL,   field_names = NULL,   deidentify = T,   force = F )

title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_DB_subset
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_DB setup_DB subset_name Character. name subset create. filter_field Character. name field database filter . filter_choices Vector. values `filter_field` used define subset. dir_other Character. directory subset file saved. Default `output` folder within database directory. file_name Character. base name file subset saved. Default `<DB$short_name>_<subset_name>`. form_names Character vector. Names forms include subset. Default `NULL`, includes forms. field_names Character vector. Names specific fields include subset. Default `NULL`, includes fields. deidentify Logical. Whether deidentify data subset. Default `TRUE`. force Logical. `TRUE`, overwrite existing subset files name. Default `FALSE`.

title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_DB_subset
text: modified `DB` object includes newly created subset. subset also saved file specified directory.

title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_DB_subset
text: function filters main REDCap database using specified `filter_field` `filter_choices`, creates new subset optional deidentification. can customized include specific forms fields. resulting subset saved file future use.

what: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_field_transformation
title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_field_transformation
text: Adds new field transformation REDCap database (`DB`). allows users define custom transformations specific field form, including type, label, choices, associated function data manipulation.

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_field_transformation
code: add_field_transformation(   DB,   field_name,   form_name,   field_type,   field_type_R = NA,   field_label = NA,   select_choices_or_calculations = NA,   field_note = NA,   identifier = "",   units = NA,   data_func = NA )

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_field_transformation
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_DB setup_DB field_name Character. name field transformation applied. form_name Character. name form containing field. field_type Character. type field REDCap (e.g., "text", "checkbox", "dropdown"). field_type_R Character. corresponding R data type field. Default `NA`. field_label Character. label field. Default `NA`. select_choices_or_calculations Character. string specifying choices (dropdown, radio, checkbox fields) calculations (calculated fields). Default `NA`. field_note Character. optional note comment field. Default `NA`. identifier Character. string indicating whether field identifier (e.g., "Y" yes). Default empty string (`""`). units Character. units measurement field, applicable. Default `NA`. data_func Function NA. optional function transform validate data field. Default `NA`.

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_field_transformation

title: Check the REDCap Log — get_REDCap_log
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_DB setup_DB last Numeric. Specifies time range paired `units` filter log. Default `24`. user Character. Optional user filter retrieve log entries associated specific username. Default empty string (`""`), includes users. units Character. Units paired `last` define time range. Options `"mins"`, `"hours"`, `"days"`. Default `"hours"`. begin_time Character. specific timestamp (e.g., "2023-07-11 13:15:06") define start log retrieval. Overrides `last` `units` provided. Default empty string (`""`). clean Logical. `TRUE`, cleans API data adds extra summary columns log. Default `TRUE`. record Character. Optional record filter retrieving log entries associated specific record. Default empty string (`""`).

title: REDCap API Method Wrapper — get_REDCap_method
text: wrapper function interacting REDCap API. function allows execute various REDCap API methods return results form `DB` object. designed simplify access REDCap API abstracting common method invocation patterns.

title: REDCap API Method Wrapper — get_REDCap_method
code: get_REDCap_method(   DB,   method,   error_action = "warn",   additional_args = NULL,   show_method_help = T )  get_REDCap_metadata(DB, include_users = T)  get_REDCap_data(DB, labelled = T, records = NULL, batch_size = 2000)  get_REDCap_version(DB, show_method_help = T)  get_REDCap_files(DB, original_file_names = F, overwrite = F)  get_REDCap_users(DB)  get_REDCap_structure(DB)  show_REDCap_API_methods()  show_REDCap_API_methods_table()

title: REDCap API Method Wrapper — get_REDCap_method
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_DB setup_DB method Character. name REDCap API method called (e.g., 'exportRecords', 'importRecords', etc.). error_action Character. action take error occurs API call. Default `"warn"`, generates warning. can also specify `"stop"` stop execution, `"ignore"` ignore errors. additional_args List. Additional arguments pass API method (). Default `NULL`. show_method_help Logical. `TRUE`, function display method-specific help information. Default `TRUE`. include_users Logical. Whether include user information data. Default FALSE. labelled Logical. Whether include labelled data (e.g., labels instead raw codes). Default FALSE. records Character vector record identifiers. Used methods filter specific records. Default NULL. batch_size Numeric. batch size uploading processing data. Default 2,000. original_file_names Logical. Whether use original uploaded filenames system-defined filenames. Default TRUE. overwrite Logical. Whether overwrite existing records uploading data. Default FALSE.

title: REDCap API Method Wrapper — get_REDCap_method
text: `DB` object results REDCap API method. object may contain data metadata depending method invoked.

title: REDCap API Method Wrapper — get_REDCap_method
text: function calls specified REDCap API method using provided database (`DB`) object, token, additional arguments. function returns results form `DB` object. error occurs, behavior determined `error_action` parameter. default, warnings issued errors.

code: setup_DB(   short_name,   dir_path,   redcap_base,   force = F,   merge_form_name = "merged",   use_csv = F,   auto_check_token = T )  load_DB(short_name, validate = T)  load_DB_from_path(DB_path, validate = T)  load_test_DB(short_name = "TEST_repeating", with_data = F)

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
text: short_name character string spaces symbols representing unique short name REDCap project. dir_path Optional character string representing directory path want REDCap project data stored. missing, DB object current R session. redcap_base character string representing base URL REDCap server. force Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, forces setup even `DB` object already exists. Default `FALSE`. merge_form_name character string representing name merged form. Default "merged". use_csv Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, uses CSV files data storage. Default `FALSE`. auto_check_token Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, automatically checks validity REDCap API token. Default `TRUE`. validate Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, validates DB object based current rules. Default `TRUE`. DB_path character string representing file path exact `<short_name>_RosyREDCap.rdata` file loaded. with_data Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, loads test DB object data user ran `update_DB`. Default `FALSE`.

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB
text: function sets `DB` object storing REDCap API token configurations required interacting REDCap server. ensures token valid ready use subsequent API calls. Neither function directly attempts communication REDCap. `setup_DB` used first time initialize/link REDCap project. Mainly, sets unique `short_name` intended directory. Unless run force = TRUE default first try load_DB. dir_path technically optional without user save/load/update projects. `load_DB` can used just `short_name` parameter already run `setup_DB` past established directory. `dir_path` optional function can used relocated directory.

title: Setup or Load RosyREDCap Project — setup_DB

title: Update REDCap Database — update_DB
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_DB setup_DB set_token_if_fails Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, prompts user set REDCap API token update fails. Default `TRUE`. force Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, forces fresh update. Default `FALSE`. day_of_log Integer. Number days checked log. Default `10`. labelled Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, returns labelled REDCap data. FALSE, returns raw data. Default `TRUE`. get_files Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, retrieves files REDCap. Default `FALSE`. original_file_names Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, uses original file names retrieved files. Default `FALSE`. entire_log Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, retrieves entire log. Default `FALSE`. metadata_only Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, updates metadata. Default `FALSE`. ask_about_overwrites Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, prompts user overwriting existing data. Default `TRUE`. save_to_dir Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, saves updated data directory. Default `TRUE`. batch_size Integer. Number records process batch. Default `2000`.

title: Update REDCap Database — update_DB
text: function updates REDCap database fetching latest data REDCap server. supports various options forcing fresh update, checking logs specified number days, retrieving files REDCap. function can also handle metadata-updates batch processing.

what: Upload from your directory to REDCap — upload_DB_to_REDCap
title: Upload from your directory to REDCap — upload_DB_to_REDCap
text: function designed upload changes locally modified `DB` object REDCap. run using `DB_import <- read_from_REDCap_upload(DB)`. function compares imported data (`DB_import`) existing data `DB` uploads new changed data. directly delete data. function potential modify data, used cautiously. changes made function logged REDCap log.

title: Upload from your directory to REDCap — upload_DB_to_REDCap
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_DB setup_DB batch_size Numeric. number records upload batch. Default 500. ask Logical. TRUE, function prompt preview data uploaded proceeding. Defaults TRUE. view_old Logical. TRUE, function show preview old records upload. Defaults TRUE. n_row_view Numeric. number rows display previewing old data. Default 20.

title: Upload File to REDCap — upload_file_to_REDCap
text: DB validated `DB` object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_DB setup_DB file character string specifying file path file uploaded. record character string specifying record ID file uploaded. field character string specifying field name file associated. repeat_instance Optional. numeric character string specifying repeat instance record. Defaults NULL. event Optional. character string specifying event name file uploaded. Defaults NULL.

title: View the REDCap API Token Stored in the Session — view_REDCap_token

title: View the REDCap API Token Stored in the Session — view_REDCap_token
text: function retrieves REDCap API token associated specified `DB` object displays message. token returned R object maintain security. Use function confirm token currently use without exposing unnecessarily.
